result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel K Daily

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel K Daily in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Samuel K Daily.  Attorney Michael Staskunas in court on behalf of Jennifer Jean Tate for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNTS 2, 4, and 5: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 11.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Parties requests a plea/sentencing date. Jury trial date is removed from the calendar. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel K Daily in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Samuel K Daily.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate and Samuel Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. States Motion to Join case with pending matter 21CF5130 and 21CF4944.  Arguments placed on the record.  Based on statements put forth by Court and parties, Court GRANTS State's motion for joinder. State place global off on the record. Parties does not have any other motions to address before trial. Case remains calendared for jury trial scheduled on October 3, 2022 at 9:00am, Branch 11.

Court is in trial. Court adjourns final pretrial. Parties notified.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Samuel K Daily in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Samuel K Daily.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Final pre-trial rescheduled as set forth in the record. Jury trial remains calendared for 10/3/22. Case adjourned to branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed: State's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Samuel K Daily not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Court set trial dates with parties. Court set the following filing deadlines with parties. Parties have until June 30th, 2022 to finle and motions. Parties have until Augusy 19th, 2022 to file any responses to motions. Case adjourned to Branch 28.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail

Defendant Samuel K Daily in court with Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn; both appear by video.  Defendant Samuel K Daily in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective M. Martin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with DC, SD, CBZ, DJP, MTW
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Samuel K Daily in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Samuel K Daily in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samuel K Daily appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number cases pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge  Sanders, Branch 28.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
